item.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him, and the <st data-num="0899" class="">garments</st>, the <st data-num="04888" class="">anointing</st> <st data-num="08081" class="">oil</st>, the <st data-num="02403" class="">sin-offering</st> <st data-num="06499" class="">bull</st>, the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="0352" class="">rams</st>, and the <st data-num="05536" class="">basket</st> of <st data-num="04682" class="">unleavened bread</st>,

and <st data-num="06950" class="">assemble</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="05712">congregation</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> of the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>.”<n id="1" />
So Moses did just as the Lord commanded him, and the congregation assembled at the entrance of the Meeting Tent.
Then Moses said to the congregation: “This is what the Lord has commanded to be done.”
So Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.

Then he<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="03801" class="">tunic</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> Aaron,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="02296" class="">wrapped</st> the <st data-num="073" class="">sash</st> <st data-num="02296" class="">around</st> him,<n id="4" /> and <st data-num="03847" class="">clothed</st> him <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="04598" class="">robe</st>.<n id="5" /> Next he <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="0646" class="">ephod</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> him<n id="6" /> and <st data-num="02296" class="">placed on</st> him<n id="7" /> the <st data-num="02805" class="">decorated band</st> of the <st data-num="0646" class="">ephod</st>, and <st data-num="0640" class="">fastened the ephod</st> closely to him with the band.<n id="8" />

He then <st data-num="07760" class="">set</st> the <st data-num="02833" class="">breastpiece</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> him and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="0224" class="">Urim</st> and <st data-num="08550" class="">Thummim</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="02833" class="">breastpiece</st>.
Finally, he set the turban on his head and attached the gold plate, the holy diadem, to the front of the turban just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
Then Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and everything in it, and so consecrated them.

Next he <st data-num="05137" class="">sprinkled</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> of it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">times</st> and so <st data-num="04886" class="">anointed</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="03627" class="">vessels</st>, and the <st data-num="03595" class="">washbasin</st> and its <st data-num="03653" class="">stand</st> to <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrate</st> them.

He then <st data-num="03332" class="">poured</st> some of the <st data-num="04888" class="">anointing</st> <st data-num="08081" class="">oil</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and <st data-num="04886" class="">anointed</st> him to <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrate</st> him.
Moses also brought forward Aaron’s sons, clothed them with tunics, wrapped sashes around them, and wrapped headbands on them just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
Then he brought near the sin-offering bull, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the sin-offering bull,

and he <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> it.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> then <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07161" class="">horns</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> with his <st data-num="0676" class="">finger</st> and <st data-num="02398" class="">purified</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>,<n id="2" /> and he <st data-num="03332" class="">poured out</st> the rest of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="03247" class="">base</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> and so <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrated</st> it to <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it.<n id="3" />

Then he<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07130" class="">entrails</st>, the <st data-num="03508" class="">protruding lobe</st> of the <st data-num="03516" class="">liver</st>, and the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st> and their <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">offered</st> it all <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> on the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>,<n id="3" />
but the rest of the bull—its hide, its flesh, and its dung—he completely burned up outside the camp just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
Then he presented the burnt-offering ram, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram,

and he <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> it.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> then <st data-num="02236" class="">splashed</st> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar’s</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">sides</st>.

Then he<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05408" class="">cut</st> the <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st> into <st data-num="05409" class="">parts</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">offered</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>, the <st data-num="05409" class="">parts</st>, and the <st data-num="06309" class="">suet</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st>,

but the entrails and the legs he washed with water, and Moses offered the whole ram up in smoke on the altar—it was a burnt offering for a soothing aroma, a gift to the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
Then he presented the second ram, the ram of ordination, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram,

and he <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> it.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> then <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> some of its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron’s</st> <st data-num="03233" class="">right</st> <st data-num="08571 0241">earlobe</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0931" class="">thumb</st> of his <st data-num="03233" class="">right</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, and <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0931" class="">big toe</st><n id="3" /> of his <st data-num="03233" class="">right</st> <st data-num="07272" class="">foot</st>.

Next he brought Aaron’s sons forward, and Moses put some of the blood on their right earlobes, on their right thumbs, and on the big toes of their right feet, and Moses splashed the rest of the blood against the altar’s sides.
Then he took the fat (the fatty tail, all the fat on the entrails, the protruding lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat) and the right thigh,

and from the basket of unleavened bread that was before the Lord he took one unleavened loaf, one loaf of bread mixed with olive oil, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat parts and on the right thigh.
He then put all of them on the palms of Aaron and his sons, who waved them as a wave offering before the Lord.
Moses then took them from their palms and offered them up in smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering—they were an ordination offering for a soothing aroma; it was a gift to the Lord.
Finally, Moses took the breast and waved it as a wave offering before the Lord from the ram of ordination. It was Moses’ share just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Then Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood which was on the altar and sprinkled it on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and his sons’ garments. So he consecrated Aaron, his garments, and his sons and his sons’ garments.

Then <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>, “<st data-num="01310" class="">Boil</st> the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> of the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st>, and <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> you are to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it and the <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is in the <st data-num="04394" class="">ordination-offering</st> <st data-num="05536" class="">basket</st>, just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> I have <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, ‘<st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> are to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it,’

but the <st data-num="03498" class="">remainder</st> of the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> and the <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st><n id="1" /> you must <st data-num="08313" class="">burn</st> with <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st>.

And you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">go out</st> from the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> of the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st> for <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> when your <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of <st data-num="04394" class="">ordination</st> are <st data-num="04390" class="">completed</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> you must be <st data-num="04390 03027">ordained</st> over a <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st>-<st data-num="03117" class="">day period</st>.<n id="1" />
What has been done on this day the Lord has commanded to be done to make atonement for you.
You must reside at the entrance of the Meeting Tent day and night for seven days and keep the charge of the Lord so that you will not die, for this is what I have been commanded.”
So Aaron and his sons did all the things the Lord had commanded through Moses.
